text: Thanks Nicholas! Iâ€™ll try swapping that out and see how we go
Do you have the right scopes in your private app <@U071VPHRPL3>? You will need contacts.read and contacts.write
I have a similar code that runs well for me but I did it with pulling the records into the action like this

Hi Team,
am trying to connect with HubSpot API for creating contact fields.
If i send :
```     "properties": {
       "email": params.email ? params.email : null,
       "firstname": params.name ? params.name : null,
       "phone": params.phone ? params.phone : null,
       "company": "XYZ",
       "website": "<https://xyz.com>",
       "country": "USA",
       "hs_analytics_source": "ORGANIC_SEARCH",
     }```
it works fine,

but when I send :
```     "properties": {
       "email": params.email ? params.email : null,
       "firstname": params.name ? params.name : null,
       "phone": params.phone ? params.phone : null,
       "company": "XYZ",
       "website": "<https://xyz.com>",
       "country": "USA",
       "hs_analytics_source": "ORGANIC_SEARCH",
       "hs_latest_source_data_1": params.original_source_drill_down_1 || null,
       "hs_latest_source_data_2": params.original_source_drill_down_2 || null,
     }```
 it does not work.

I checked on my HubSpot account, it states that,
hs_latest_source_data_1 and hs_latest_source_data_2, which is related to Drill Down 1 and 2 respectively, are "This property is provided by HubSpot and cannot be eddited"

Right now by default, this field stays empty when the data is sent, (first code snippet), but when we try to send some data to that field, it gives "Bad Request" error (403)

What is the workarroun in this case ?
I am want to send this data to HubSpot to know from where the user has contacted us, i.e from APP or from Website.

Please Help !!

Thanks !!

Hey <@U07202MSTE1> some properties are read only in HubSpot so you cannot change them, API or with UI. Original Source works because it is read and write, but the Latest Source drilldown 1 and 2 are read only. Perhaps create custom properties for them? Not sure if that will work for you
